string-array.name: christmas
string-array.item: Annual commemoration of the birth of Jesus Christ

string-array.name: familyDay
string-array.item: Observed on the third Monday of February in the provinces of AB, MB, ON, NS, PEI, and SK. In the provinces of MB, NS, and PEI, the holiday is instead termed Louis Riel Day, Nova Scotia Heritage Day, and Islander Day respectively.

string-array.name: familyDayBC
string-array.item: A statutory holiday occurring on second Monday in February observed in BC

string-array.name: goodFriday
string-array.item: Good Friday is a religious holiday, observed primarily by Christians, commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his death at Calvary.

string-array.name: easterMondayCanada
string-array.item: Easter Monday is the day after Easter Sunday and is celebrated as a holiday in some largely Christian cultures, especially Catholic and Eastern Christian cultures. Observed in Quebec.

string-array.name: victoriaDay
string-array.item: A federal Canadian public holiday celebrated on the last Monday before May 25, in honour of Queen Victoria\'s birthday.

string-array.name: canadaDay
string-array.item: National day of Canada, celebrating the anniversary of the July 1, 1867, enactment of the British North America Act, 1867.

string-array.name: civicHoliday
string-array.item: A public holiday celebrated in most of Canada on the first Monday in August

string-array.name: labourDayCanada
string-array.item: Annual holiday to celebrate the achievements of workers

string-array.name: thanksgivingCanada
string-array.item: Occurring on the second Monday in October, is an annual Canadian holiday which celebrates the harvest and other blessings of the past year.

string-array.name: remembranceDay
string-array.item: A memorial day observed in Commonwealth countries since the end of World War I to remember the members of their armed forces who have died in the line of duty.

string-array.name: boxingDayCanada
string-array.item: The first or second weekday after Christmas Day.Observed in Ontario

string-array.name: newYear
string-array.item: The first day of the year on the modern Gregorian calendar as well as the Julian calendar used in the Roman Empire since 45 BC.

string-array.name: washingtonDay
string-array.item: A United States federal holiday celebrated on the third Monday of February in honor of George Washington, the first President of the United States.

string-array.name: memorialDayUsa
string-array.item: A day of remembering the men and women who died while serving in the United States Armed Forces

string-array.name: independenceDayUsa
string-array.item: Commemorating the adoption of the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 1776, declaring independence from the Kingdom of Great Britain. July 4 being Saturday, holiday will be on July 3.

string-array.name: laborDayUsa
string-array.item: A celebration of the American labor movement and is dedicated to the social and economic achievements of workers

string-array.name: columbusDay
string-array.item: The anniversary of Christopher Columbus\' arrival in the Americas, which happened on October 12, 1492

string-array.name: veteransDay
string-array.item: Honors people who have served in the U.S. Armed Forces, also known as veterans

string-array.name: thanksgivingUsa
string-array.item: A day of giving thanks for the blessing of the harvest and of the preceding year

string-array.name: martinLutherDay
string-array.item: An American federal holiday marking the birthday of Martin Luther King, Jr. It is observed on the third Monday of January each year, which is around the time of King\'s birthday, January 15.

string-array.name: australiaDay
string-array.item: The official national day of Australia, celebrated annually on 26 January, which marks the anniversary of the 1788 arrival of the First Fleet of British Ships at Sydney Cove, New South Wales, and raising of the Flag of Great Britain at that site by Governor Arthur Phillip

string-array.name: canberraDay
string-array.item: A public holiday held annually on the second Monday in March in the Australian Capital Territory (ACT) to celebrate the official naming of Canberra. Observed in Australian Capital Territory.

string-array.name: easterSaturday
string-array.item: Easter Saturday, or Bright Saturday, on the Christian calendar is the Saturday following the festival of Easter, the Saturday of Easter or Bright Week.

string-array.name: easterMondayAus
string-array.item: Easter Monday in the Roman Catholic liturgical calendar is the second day of the octave of Easter Week and analogously in the Eastern Orthodox Church is the second day of Bright Week.

string-array.name: anzacDay
string-array.item: A national day of remembrance in Australia and New Zealand that broadly commemorates all Australians and New Zealanders "who served and died in all wars, conflicts, and peacekeeping operations" and "the contribution and suffering of all those who have served."

string-array.name: queensBirthday
string-array.item: The selected day on which the birthday of the monarch of the Commonwealth realms (currently Queen Elizabeth II) is officially celebrated

string-array.name: labourDayAus
string-array.item: Annual holiday to celebrate the achievements of workers. Observed in Australian Capital Territory, New South Wales and South Australia.

string-array.name: boxingDay
string-array.item: Boxing Day is a holiday traditionally celebrated the day following Christmas Day

string-array.name: easterMondayUk
string-array.item: Easter Monday in the Roman Catholic liturgical calendar is the second day of the octave of Easter Week and analogously in the Eastern Orthodox Church is the second day of Bright Week.Observed in England, Northern Ireland and Wales.

string-array.name: mayDayHoliday
string-array.item: A traditional spring holiday and coincides with International Workers\' Day

string-array.name: summerBankHolidayFirst
string-array.item: First Monday in August. Observed in Scotland.

string-array.name: summerBankHolidayLast
string-array.item: Last Monday in August. Observed in England, Northern Ireland and Wales.

string-array.name: halloween
string-array.item: A yearly celebration on 31 October, the eve of the Western Christian feast of All Hallows\' Day

string-array.name: guyFawkesDay
string-array.item: Guy Fawkes Day, also known as Guy Fawkes Night, Bonfire Night and Firework Night, is an annual commemoration observed on 5 November
